title: Bug 102516 - JDBC Data Set Editor should load tables and columns on demand
description: The JDBC Data Set Editor page for a SQL Query has a tree control that lists the tables and columns in your data source.
OB: When using the JTOpenJDBC drivers on the iSeries platform, the tree control displays every schema (aka catalog) on the system, which easily amounts to several hundred tables. I noticed this behavior when I used the code from CVS dated 6/30/05. Although there is a schema filter, I still receive a warning message during the page load because the tree is being populated at that time.
EB: I expect the loading of the tree to be deferred until the user either expands the tree or applies a filter. This would prevent the warning message from appearing during the initial page load.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Open the JDBC Data Set Editor for a SQL Query.
2. Use the JTOpenJDBC drivers on the iSeries platform.
3. Observe the tree control, which should display all schemas.
4. Notice that a warning message appears during the page load due to the tree being populated at this time.
